clinical_study.brief_title: Reproducibility of Glucose Fluctuations by Standardized Exercise for Patients With Type 1 Diabetes - a Method Study Based on Continuous Glucose Monitoring
clinical_study.official_title: Reproducibility of Glucose Fluctuations by Standardized Exercise for Patients With Type 1 Diabetes - a Method Study Based on Continuous Glucose Monitoring

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this project is to investigate whether the glucose response in type 1 diabetes patients measured using Continuous Glucose Monitoring measurement is reproducible in repeated standardized test sessions that include physical activity.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood glucose response measured with CGM
primary_outcome.description: The participants will be tested on the research facility on a hospital in Denmark

intervention.intervention_name: Blood glucose measured using CGM during standardized physical activity
intervention.description: Standardized exercise on bicycle at 70% of the participants work capacity for ½ hour.

study_pop.textblock: 20 patients with type 1 diabetes (treated with or without insulin pump) will participate in three identical test sessions on an exercise bike. During the three test sessions, patients will be monitored by heartrate, blood glucose (obtained by lancet) and CGM. The participants will also be using a diary for registration of diet as well as exercise during the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Type 1 diabetes with a diabetes duration of at least 2 years
- age 18-60 years (inclusive)
- given informed consent
- exercises (at least 30 minutes intentional exercise where participants feel exhausted) one or more times a week
- participants agree to use CGM correctly
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- exercising at a high level (five or more times a week with high intensity)
- treatment with prednisolone or less than a month ago contestant has been treated with prednisolone
- treatment with beta blockers
- Abuse of alcohol / drugs
